clients.title: Clients
clients.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this client?
clients.confirmRegenerateKeys: Are you sure you want to regenerate client keys? The client will need to update their configuration.
clients.settingsWarning: These settings affect only the generation of configurations below and do not affect server operation.
clients.maskingTypeOverrideDisabled: Unavailable because "Disallow Other Masking" is enabled in general settings.
clients.maskingTypeOverrideDescription: Protocol under which the client's network traffic will be masked. Used to bypass blocking.
clients.obfuscatorPortDescription: Port that will be used for communication between WireGuard and WireGuard Obfuscator on the user's device. Can be any free port from 1 to 65535. Recommended to change only if the default port is already in use by another application.
clients.obfuscatorPortInvalid: Port must be a number between 1 and 65535
clients.allowedIpsMinOne: At least one subnet must be specified
clients.allowedIpsInvalidFormat: Invalid subnet format. Use CIDR format (e.g., 0.0.0.0/0)
clients.allowedIPsDescription: List of IP addresses and subnets for which packets will be routed through the VPN connection. Format: address/mask (e.g., 0.0.0.0/0 for all internet traffic). At least one subnet must be specified.
clients.verbosityLevelDescription: Log verbosity level for the obfuscator on the client side. More detailed logs can help troubleshoot issues if they occur.

config.title: Configuration
config.subnetDescription: Subnet within the VPN network. Should only be changed if the current address range conflicts with addresses already used by clients. Must always have a /24 mask.
config.enableObfuscationDescription: If disabled, the server will operate in standard WireGuard mode.
config.obfuscationKeyDescription: Obfuscation key for client-server communication. Can be any string up to 300 characters (ASCII only).
config.obfuscatorVerbosityDescription: More detailed logs can help troubleshoot issues if they occur.
config.maskingTypeDescription: Protocol under which network traffic will be masked. Used to bypass blocking. The masking type that will be set in user configs by default.
config.maskingForcedDescription: Prevent users from connecting with a different masking type.
config.confirmRegenerateKeys: Are you sure you want to regenerate server keys? All clients will need to update their configurations.
config.confirmObfuscationKeyChange: The obfuscation key has been changed. After saving, all clients will need to update their obfuscator configurations. Continue?
config.metricsTokenDescription: Special token for accessing the Prometheus-compatible metrics endpoints.
config.confirmDeleteMetricsToken: Are you sure you want to delete the metrics token?
config.metricsTokenInstructionsStep1: 1. Add a scrape job in prometheus.yml for this server.
config.metricsTokenInstructionsStep2: 2. Use the following endpoints (replace {username} where needed) and add the Authorization header:
config.metricsTokenInstructionsStep3: 3. Set the HTTP header Authorization: Bearer <token> in the scrape configuration.
config.timezoneDescription: System timezone affects only timestamps in logs. Changes apply immediately without restarting the container.
config.credentialsChanged: Credentials changed successfully. Please login again.

errors.networkError: Network error. Please check your connection.
errors.serverError: Server error. Please try again later.
